| History                 = Humanitech was a start-up robotics company founded by [[Xander Zynn (Earth-616)|Dr. Xander Zynn]]. It employed [[Barbara Morse (Earth-616)|Bobbi Morse]] to design its security systems.

Zynn intended to make affordable artificial intelligence a reality with the invention of the [[Humanitron]]. To this end, Humanitech captured the supervillain [[Quicksand (Nguyet) (Earth-616)|Quicksand]] and split her into particles of smart sand which comprised the silicon matrix of each Humanitron.

The [[Daily Bugle (Front Line) (Earth-616)|Daily Bugle]]'s science section scored a guided tour around Humanitech's facilities due to Morse's boyfriend, [[Peter Parker (Earth-616)|Peter Parker]] being the Bugle's science editor. During the visit, Peter noticed the readouts of the Humanitron's A.I. looked extremely similar to actual human brain patterns. When a reporter attempted to take a look under the case of a Humanitron, the android lunged at him. Parker tackled the robot, but heard what appeared to be a cry from help from it.

Later that day, Peter returned to Humanitech as Spider-Man and broke into the building with Mockingbird's help. While looking into the Humanitrons' A.I., the heroes were attacked by a horde of them. Spider-Man began cracking open the cases of the Humanitrons, and their matrices jumped out of the robots, bonding together and reforming into Quicksand. Spider-Man convinced Quicksand to spare Zynn's life at the moment, and she agreed in gratitude for being freed. Dr. Zynn ran far away, and Humanitech's resources were absorbed by [[Alchemax (Earth-616)|Alchemax]].{{r|Amazing Spider-Man Vol 1 791}}
